column18: 08/11/2013: An explosive device detonated outside of the home of a Montenegrin journalist near Berane city, Berane municipality, Montenegro. No one was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
column64: The specific motive is unknown; however, authorities stated that the bombing at the journalist's home was a warning for him to stop his work on crime and corruption.

column18: 12/26/2013: An assailant threw an explosive device at the office of Mihail Jovic, editor-in-chief of the Vijesti Daily newspaper, in Podgorica, Podgorica municipality, Montenegro. There were no reported casualties; however, the office was damaged. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
column64: The specific motive is unknown; however, sources noted that the newspaper whose offices had a history of criticizing the Montenegrin government and that the paper's journalists had been attacked before.
column97: A thrown explosive device was used in the attack.
column108: A newspaper office was damaged in this attack.
